title: Motorist and public works department employee discuss the results of the car's performance after testing at an auto emission inspection station in Norwood, Ohio. Since January, 1975, all light duty, spark ignition powered vehicles in Hamilton County must be tested annually for carbon monoxide and hydrocarbon emissions. Officials expected 74 percent of the vehicles in both Norwood and Cincinnati would be tested by the end of 1975.
